Definitions
subSections.text:
{{zh-hanzi}}

# {{lb|zh|religion}} [[god]]; [[deity]]; [[spirit]]
#* {{zh-x|神 說：「^要 有 光」，就 有 了 光。|And '''God''' said, Let there be light: and there was light.|ref={{w2|zh|新標點和合本}} ({{w|Chinese Union Version|Chinese Union Version with New Punctuation}}), {{lang|zh|創世記}} (Genesis) 1:3}}
# [[spirit]]; [[soul]]; [[mind]]
# [[expression]]; [[countenance]]; [[appearance]]
# [[supernatural]]; [[magic]]; [[psychic]]
# {{surname|lang=zh}} [[Shen]]

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text:
Different branches of Christianity use different terms for God:
* {{zh-l|神}} and {{zh-l|上帝}} are used by Protestants.
* {{zh-l|天主}} is used by Roman Catholics.

subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}} {{wikipedia|Kami}} {{wikipedia|God}}
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|かみ}} ⟨kami{{sub|2}}⟩ → */kamɨ/ → /kami/ From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=かみ|-}}, ultimately from {{inh|ja|jpx-pro|*kamuy}}. Not related to {{m|ja|上|tr={{upright|/kami{{sub|1}}/}}||up}} or {{m|ja|髪|tr={{upright|/kami{{sub|1}}/}}||hair}}. Possibly cognate with {{cog|ko|검|t=God, Spirit}}. Often appears in compounds as {{IPAchar|/kamu/}} (modern {{IPAchar|/kaɴ/}}), indicating that {{IPAchar|/kami/}} is a bound or fused form deriving from *{{IPAchar|/kamu.i/}}. Note that this final ''i'' may be the {{cog|ojp|-}} emphatic nominative particle {{m|ja|い|tr=i}}, likely cognate with {{cog|ko|-}} nominative particle {{m|ko|이}}. Such fusion has occurred in other {{cog|ja|-}} terms, such as {{m|ja|目|tr=me||eye|pos=from ''ma'' + ''i''}} or {{m|ja|酒|tr=sake||saké, liquor|pos=from ''saka'' + ''i''}}. Compare {{cog|ain|カムイ|tr=kamuy||god}}.
